Cryptocurrency: Cryptocurrency is a digital or virtual form of currency that uses cryptography for security. You can use it to make payments online or in stores that accept it.
Prepaid Cards: A prepaid card is a card that you can load with a certain amount of money. You can use it to make payments online or in stores.
Bartering: Bartering is the exchange of goods or services for other goods or services. You can use it to pay for things without using money.
Time Banking: Time banking is a system in which people exchange services instead of money. You can earn time credits by providing services to others and use them to pay for services you need.
Local Exchange Trading Systems (LETS): LETS is a system in which people exchange goods and services without using money. You can use it to pay for things in your local community.
